title: Ask Sir John Timpson: Some of my co-workers feel under observation in our open-concept office
text:
Q What do you make of open offices, which my company has? Some of my co-workers say they feel exposed and under constant observation (and are more on edge and distracted), while others say that it’s good for socialising and keeping spirits up. Is it time to bring back some workplace privacy?

A The first time I saw a completely open office was when I visited Mothercare in the late 1960s. Founder and managing director Selim Silkha was way ahead of his time.

The business was run from a big open space with reception at one end and their board table at the other.

High-level meetings were held in sight of colleagues from the lowest level of the management structure.
